intro: Hieracium jurassicum subsp. cichoriaceum, commonly known as the Jurassic hawkweed, is a flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow composite flowers, which consist of both ray and disk florets. The plant typically grows in moist, disturbed soils and is found in temperate regions. It has lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges and can reach heights of up to 30 centimeters. This subspecies is notable for its historical significance in botanical studies due to its unique morphology and distribution.
